14#ifndef ISC_BUFFER_H
15#define ISC_BUFFER_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file isc/buffer.h
22 *
23 * \brief A buffer is a region of memory, together with a set of related subregions.
24 * Buffers are used for parsing and I/O operations.
25 *
26 * The 'used region' and the 'available' region are disjoint, and their
27 * union is the buffer's region. The used region extends from the beginning
28 * of the buffer region to the last used byte. The available region
29 * extends from one byte greater than the last used byte to the end of the
30 * buffer's region. The size of the used region can be changed using various
31 * buffer commands. Initially, the used region is empty.
32 *
33 * The used region is further subdivided into two disjoint regions: the
34 * 'consumed region' and the 'remaining region'. The union of these two
35 * regions is the used region. The consumed region extends from the beginning
36 * of the used region to the byte before the 'current' offset (if any). The
37 * 'remaining' region the current pointer to the end of the used
38 * region. The size of the consumed region can be changed using various
39 * buffer commands. Initially, the consumed region is empty.
40 *
41 * The 'active region' is an (optional) subregion of the remaining region.
42 * It extends from the current offset to an offset in the remaining region
43 * that is selected with isc_buffer_setactive(). Initially, the active region
44 * is empty. If the current offset advances beyond the chosen offset, the
45 * active region will also be empty.
46 *
47 * \verbatim
48 * /------------entire length---------------\
49 * /----- used region -----\/-- available --\
50 * +----------------------------------------+
51 * | consumed | remaining | |
52 * +----------------------------------------+
53 * a b c d e
54 *
55 * a == base of buffer.
56 * b == current pointer. Can be anywhere between a and d.
57 * c == active pointer. Meaningful between b and d.
58 * d == used pointer.
59 * e == length of buffer.
60 *
61 * a-e == entire length of buffer.
62 * a-d == used region.
63 * a-b == consumed region.
64 * b-d == remaining region.
65 * b-c == optional active region.
66 *\endverbatim
67 *
68 * The following invariants are maintained by all routines:
69 *
70 *\code
71 * length > 0
72 *
73 * base is a valid pointer to length bytes of memory
74 *
75 * 0 <= used <= length
76 *
77 * 0 <= current <= used
78 *
79 * 0 <= active <= used
80 * (although active < current implies empty active region)
81 *\endcode
82 *
83 * \li MP:
84 * Buffers have no synchronization. Clients must ensure exclusive
85 * access.
86 *
87 * \li Reliability:
88 * No anticipated impact.
89 *
90 * \li Resources:
91 * Memory: 1 pointer + 6 unsigned integers per buffer.
92 *
93 * \li Security:
94 * No anticipated impact.
95 *
96 * \li Standards:
97 * None.
98 */
99
100/***
101 *** Imports
102 ***/
103
104#include <inttypes.h>
105#include <stdbool.h>
106
107#include <isc/assertions.h>
108#include <isc/formatcheck.h>
109#include <isc/lang.h>
110#include <isc/likely.h>
111#include <isc/magic.h>
112#include <isc/types.h>
113
114/*!
115 * To make many functions be inline macros (via \#define) define this.
116 * If it is undefined, a function will be used.
117 */
118/* #define ISC_BUFFER_USEINLINE */
119
120ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
121
122/*@{*/
123/*!
124 *** Magic numbers
125 ***/
126#define ISC_BUFFER_MAGIC 0x42756621U /* Buf!. */
127#define ISC_BUFFER_VALID(b) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(b, ISC_BUFFER_MAGIC)
128/*@}*/
129
130/*!
131 * Size granularity for dynamically resizeable buffers; when reserving
132 * space in a buffer, we round the allocated buffer length up to the
133 * nearest * multiple of this value.
134 */
135#define ISC_BUFFER_INCR 2048
136
137/*
138 * The following macros MUST be used only on valid buffers. It is the
139 * caller's responsibility to ensure this by using the ISC_BUFFER_VALID
140 * check above, or by calling another isc_buffer_*() function (rather than
141 * another macro.)
142 */
143
144/*@{*/
145/*!
146 * Fundamental buffer elements. (A through E in the introductory comment.)
147 */
148#define isc_buffer_base(b) ((void *)(b)->base) /*a*/
149#define isc_buffer_current(b) \
150 ((void *)((unsigned char *)(b)->base + (b)->current)) /*b*/
151#define isc_buffer_active(b) \
152 ((void *)((unsigned char *)(b)->base + (b)->active)) /*c*/
153#define isc_buffer_used(b) \
154 ((void *)((unsigned char *)(b)->base + (b)->used)) /*d*/
155#define isc_buffer_length(b) ((b)->length) /*e*/
156/*@}*/
157
158/*@{*/
159/*!
160 * Derived lengths. (Described in the introductory comment.)
161 */
162#define isc_buffer_usedlength(b) ((b)->used) /* d-a */
163#define isc_buffer_consumedlength(b) ((b)->current) /* b-a */
164#define isc_buffer_remaininglength(b) ((b)->used - (b)->current) /* d-b */
165#define isc_buffer_activelength(b) ((b)->active - (b)->current) /* c-b */
166#define isc_buffer_availablelength(b) ((b)->length - (b)->used) /* e-d */
167/*@}*/
168
169/*!
170 * Note that the buffer structure is public. This is principally so buffer
171 * operations can be implemented using macros. Applications are strongly
172 * discouraged from directly manipulating the structure.
173 */
174
175struct isc_buffer {
176 unsigned int magic;
177 void *base;
178 /*@{*/
179 /*! The following integers are byte offsets from 'base'. */
180 unsigned int length;
181 unsigned int used;
182 unsigned int current;
183 unsigned int active;
184 /*@}*/
185 /*! linkable */
186 ISC_LINK(isc_buffer_t) link;
187 /*! private internal elements */
188 isc_mem_t *mctx;
189 /* automatically realloc buffer at put* */
190 bool autore;
191};
192
193/***
194 *** Functions
195 ***/
196
197isc_result_t
198isc_buffer_allocate(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer,
199 unsigned int length);
200/*!<
201 * \brief Allocate a dynamic linkable buffer which has "length" bytes in the
202 * data region.
203 *
204 * Requires:
205 *\li "mctx" is valid.
206 *
207 *\li "dynbuffer" is non-NULL, and "*dynbuffer" is NULL.
208 *
209 * Returns:
210 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS - success
211 *\li ISC_R_NOMEMORY - no memory available
212 *
213 * Note:
214 *\li Changing the buffer's length field is not permitted.
215 */
216
217isc_result_t
218isc_buffer_reserve(isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer, unsigned int size);
219/*!<
220 * \brief Make "size" bytes of space available in the buffer. The buffer
221 * pointer may move when you call this function.
222 *
223 * Requires:
224 *\li "dynbuffer" is not NULL.
225 *
226 *\li "*dynbuffer" is a valid dynamic buffer.
227 *
228 * Returns:
229 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS - success
230 *\li ISC_R_NOMEMORY - no memory available
231 *
232 * Ensures:
233 *\li "*dynbuffer" will be valid on return and will contain all the
234 * original data. However, the buffer pointer may be moved during
235 * reallocation.
236 */
237
238void
239isc_buffer_free(isc_buffer_t **dynbuffer);
240/*!<
241 * \brief Release resources allocated for a dynamic buffer.
242 *
243 * Requires:
244 *\li "dynbuffer" is not NULL.
245 *
246 *\li "*dynbuffer" is a valid dynamic buffer.
247 *
248 * Ensures:
249 *\li "*dynbuffer" will be NULL on return, and all memory associated with
250 * the dynamic buffer is returned to the memory context used in
251 * isc_buffer_allocate().
252 */
253
254void
255isc__buffer_init(isc_buffer_t *b, void *base, unsigned int length);
256/*!<
257 * \brief Make 'b' refer to the 'length'-byte region starting at base.
258 *
259 * Requires:
260 *
261 *\li 'length' > 0
262 *
263 *\li 'base' is a pointer to a sequence of 'length' bytes.
264 *
265 */
266
267void
268isc__buffer_initnull(isc_buffer_t *b);
269/*!<
270 *\brief Initialize a buffer 'b' with a null data and zero length/
271 */
272
273void
274isc_buffer_reinit(isc_buffer_t *b, void *base, unsigned int length);
275/*!<
276 * \brief Make 'b' refer to the 'length'-byte region starting at base.
277 * Any existing data will be copied.
278 *
279 * Requires:
280 *
281 *\li 'length' > 0 AND length >= previous length
282 *
283 *\li 'base' is a pointer to a sequence of 'length' bytes.
284 *
285 */
286
287void
288isc__buffer_invalidate(isc_buffer_t *b);
289/*!<
290 * \brief Make 'b' an invalid buffer.
291 *
292 * Requires:
293 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
294 *
295 * Ensures:
296 *\li If assertion checking is enabled, future attempts to use 'b' without
297 * calling isc_buffer_init() on it will cause an assertion failure.
298 */
299
300void
301isc_buffer_setautorealloc(isc_buffer_t *b, bool enable);
302/*!<
303 * \brief Enable or disable autoreallocation on 'b'.
304 *
305 * Requires:
306 *\li 'b' is a valid dynamic buffer (b->mctx != NULL).
307 *
308 */
309
310void
311isc__buffer_region(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
312/*!<
313 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the region of 'b'.
314 *
315 * Requires:
316 *
317 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
318 *
319 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
320 */
321
322void
323isc__buffer_usedregion(const isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
324/*!<
325 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the used region of 'b'.
326 *
327 * Requires:
328 *
329 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
330 *
331 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
332 */
333
334void
335isc__buffer_availableregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
336/*!<
337 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the available region of 'b'.
338 *
339 * Requires:
340 *
341 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
342 *
343 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
344 */
345
346void
347isc__buffer_add(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n);
348/*!<
349 * \brief Increase the 'used' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
350 *
351 * Requires:
352 *
353 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
354 *
355 *\li used + n <= length
356 *
357 */
358
359void
360isc__buffer_subtract(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n);
361/*!<
362 * \brief Decrease the 'used' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
363 *
364 * Requires:
365 *
366 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
367 *
368 *\li used >= n
369 *
370 */
371
372void
373isc__buffer_clear(isc_buffer_t *b);
374/*!<
375 * \brief Make the used region empty.
376 *
377 * Requires:
378 *
379 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
380 *
381 * Ensures:
382 *
383 *\li used = 0
384 *
385 */
386
387void
388isc__buffer_consumedregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
389/*!<
390 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the consumed region of 'b'.
391 *
392 * Requires:
393 *
394 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
395 *
396 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
397 */
398
399void
400isc__buffer_remainingregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
401/*!<
402 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the remaining region of 'b'.
403 *
404 * Requires:
405 *
406 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
407 *
408 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
409 */
410
411void
412isc__buffer_activeregion(isc_buffer_t *b, isc_region_t *r);
413/*!<
414 * \brief Make 'r' refer to the active region of 'b'.
415 *
416 * Requires:
417 *
418 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
419 *
420 *\li 'r' points to a region structure.
421 */
422
423void
424isc__buffer_setactive(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n);
425/*!<
426 * \brief Sets the end of the active region 'n' bytes after current.
427 *
428 * Requires:
429 *
430 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
431 *
432 *\li current + n <= used
433 */
434
435void
436isc__buffer_first(isc_buffer_t *b);
437/*!<
438 * \brief Make the consumed region empty.
439 *
440 * Requires:
441 *
442 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
443 *
444 * Ensures:
445 *
446 *\li current == 0
447 *
448 */
449
450void
451isc__buffer_forward(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n);
452/*!<
453 * \brief Increase the 'consumed' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
454 *
455 * Requires:
456 *
457 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
458 *
459 *\li current + n <= used
460 *
461 */
462
463void
464isc__buffer_back(isc_buffer_t *b, unsigned int n);
465/*!<
466 * \brief Decrease the 'consumed' region of 'b' by 'n' bytes.
467 *
468 * Requires:
469 *
470 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
471 *
472 *\li n <= current
473 *
474 */
475
476void
477isc_buffer_compact(isc_buffer_t *b);
478/*!<
479 * \brief Compact the used region by moving the remaining region so it occurs
480 * at the start of the buffer. The used region is shrunk by the size of
481 * the consumed region, and the consumed region is then made empty.
482 *
483 * Requires:
484 *
485 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer
486 *
487 * Ensures:
488 *
489 *\li current == 0
490 *
491 *\li The size of the used region is now equal to the size of the remaining
492 * region (as it was before the call). The contents of the used region
493 * are those of the remaining region (as it was before the call).
494 */
495
496uint8_t
497isc_buffer_getuint8(isc_buffer_t *b);
498/*!<
499 * \brief Read an unsigned 8-bit integer from 'b' and return it.
500 *
501 * Requires:
502 *
503 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
504 *
505 *\li The length of the available region of 'b' is at least 1.
506 *
507 * Ensures:
508 *
509 *\li The current pointer in 'b' is advanced by 1.
510 *
511 * Returns:
512 *
513 *\li A 8-bit unsigned integer.
514 */
515
516void
517isc__buffer_putuint8(isc_buffer_t *b, uint8_t val);
518/*!<
519 * \brief Store an unsigned 8-bit integer from 'val' into 'b'.
520 *
521 * Requires:
522 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
523 *
524 *\li The length of the unused region of 'b' is at least 1
525 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
526 *
527 * Ensures:
528 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by 1.
529 */
530
531uint16_t
532isc_buffer_getuint16(isc_buffer_t *b);
533/*!<
534 * \brief Read an unsigned 16-bit integer in network byte order from 'b', convert
535 * it to host byte order, and return it.
536 *
537 * Requires:
538 *
539 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
540 *
541 *\li The length of the available region of 'b' is at least 2
542 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
543 *
544 * Ensures:
545 *
546 *\li The current pointer in 'b' is advanced by 2.
547 *
548 * Returns:
549 *
550 *\li A 16-bit unsigned integer.
551 */
552
553void
554isc__buffer_putuint16(isc_buffer_t *b, uint16_t val);
555/*!<
556 * \brief Store an unsigned 16-bit integer in host byte order from 'val'
557 * into 'b' in network byte order.
558 *
559 * Requires:
560 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
561 *
562 *\li The length of the unused region of 'b' is at least 2
563 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
564 *
565 * Ensures:
566 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by 2.
567 */
568
569uint32_t
570isc_buffer_getuint32(isc_buffer_t *b);
571/*!<
572 * \brief Read an unsigned 32-bit integer in network byte order from 'b', convert
573 * it to host byte order, and return it.
574 *
575 * Requires:
576 *
577 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
578 *
579 *\li The length of the available region of 'b' is at least 4.
580 *
581 * Ensures:
582 *
583 *\li The current pointer in 'b' is advanced by 4.
584 *
585 * Returns:
586 *
587 *\li A 32-bit unsigned integer.
588 */
589
590void
591isc__buffer_putuint32(isc_buffer_t *b, uint32_t val);
592/*!<
593 * \brief Store an unsigned 32-bit integer in host byte order from 'val'
594 * into 'b' in network byte order.
595 *
596 * Requires:
597 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
598 *
599 *\li The length of the unused region of 'b' is at least 4
600 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
601 *
602 * Ensures:
603 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by 4.
604 */
605
606uint64_t
607isc_buffer_getuint48(isc_buffer_t *b);
608/*!<
609 * \brief Read an unsigned 48-bit integer in network byte order from 'b',
610 * convert it to host byte order, and return it.
611 *
612 * Requires:
613 *
614 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
615 *
616 *\li The length of the available region of 'b' is at least 6.
617 *
618 * Ensures:
619 *
620 *\li The current pointer in 'b' is advanced by 6.
621 *
622 * Returns:
623 *
624 *\li A 48-bit unsigned integer (stored in a 64-bit integer).
625 */
626
627void
628isc__buffer_putuint48(isc_buffer_t *b, uint64_t val);
629/*!<
630 * \brief Store an unsigned 48-bit integer in host byte order from 'val'
631 * into 'b' in network byte order.
632 *
633 * Requires:
634 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
635 *
636 *\li The length of the unused region of 'b' is at least 6
637 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
638 *
639 * Ensures:
640 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by 6.
641 */
642
643void
644isc__buffer_putuint24(isc_buffer_t *b, uint32_t val);
645/*!<
646 * Store an unsigned 24-bit integer in host byte order from 'val'
647 * into 'b' in network byte order.
648 *
649 * Requires:
650 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
651 *
652 * The length of the unused region of 'b' is at least 3
653 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
654 *
655 * Ensures:
656 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by 3.
657 */
658
659void
660isc__buffer_putmem(isc_buffer_t *b, const unsigned char *base,
661 unsigned int length);
662/*!<
663 * \brief Copy 'length' bytes of memory at 'base' into 'b'.
664 *
665 * Requires:
666 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer, and it has at least 'length'
667 * or the buffer has autoreallocation enabled.
668 *
669 *\li 'base' points to 'length' bytes of valid memory.
670 *
671 */
672
673void
674isc__buffer_putstr(isc_buffer_t *b, const char *source);
675/*!<
676 * \brief Copy 'source' into 'b', not including terminating NUL.
677 *
678 * Requires:
679 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
680 *
681 *\li 'source' to be a valid NULL terminated string.
682 *
683 *\li strlen(source) <= isc_buffer_available(b) || b->mctx != NULL
684 */
685
686void
687isc_buffer_putdecint(isc_buffer_t *b, int64_t v);
688/*!<
689 * \brief Put decimal representation of 'v' in b
690 *
691 * Requires:
692 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
693 *
694 *\li strlen(dec(v)) <= isc_buffer_available(b) || b->mctx != NULL
695 */
696
697
698
699isc_result_t
700isc_buffer_copyregion(isc_buffer_t *b, const isc_region_t *r);
701/*!<
702 * \brief Copy the contents of 'r' into 'b'.
703 *
704 * Requires:
705 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
706 *
707 *\li 'r' is a valid region.
708 *
709 * Returns:
710 *
711 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
712 *\li ISC_R_NOSPACE The available region of 'b' is not
713 * big enough.
714 */
715
716isc_result_t
717isc_buffer_dup(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t **dstp, const isc_buffer_t *src);
718/*!<
719 * \brief Allocate 'dst' and copy used contents of 'src' into it
720 *
721 * Requires:
722 *\li 'dstp' is not NULL and *dst is NULL
723 *\li 'src' is a valid buffer.
724 *
725 * Returns:
726 *
727 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
728 *\li ISC_R_NOSPACE The available region of 'b' is not
729 * big enough.
730 */
731
732isc_result_t
733isc_buffer_printf(isc_buffer_t *b, const char *format, ...)
734 ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(2, 3);
735/*!<
736 * \brief Append a formatted string to the used region of 'b'.
737 *
738 * Notes:
739 *
740 *\li The 'format' argument is a printf(3) string, with additional arguments
741 * as necessary.
742 *
743 *\li If 'b' has autoreallocation enabled, and the formatted string
744 * would overrun the buffer, the buffer is reallocated.
745 *
746 * Requires:
747 *
748 *\li 'b' is a valid buffer.
749 *
750 * Ensures:
751 *
752 *\li The used pointer in 'b' is advanced by the number of bytes appended
753 * (excluding the terminating NULL byte).
754 *
755 * Returns:
756 *
757 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Operation succeeded.
758 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE 'b' does not allow reallocation and appending the
759 * formatted string to it would cause it to overflow.
760 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY Reallocation failed.
761 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE Other error occurred.
762 */
763
764ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
765
766/*
767 * Inline macro versions of the functions. These should never be called
768 * directly by an application, but will be used by the functions within
769 * buffer.c. The callers should always use "isc_buffer_*()" names, never
770 * ones beginning with "isc__"
771 */
772
773/*! \note
774 * XXXDCL Something more could be done with initializing buffers that
775 * point to const data. For example, isc_buffer_constinit() could
776 * set a new boolean flag in the buffer structure indicating whether
777 * the buffer was initialized with that function. * Then if the
778 * boolean were true, the isc_buffer_put* functions could assert a
779 * contractual requirement for a non-const buffer.
780 *
781 * One drawback is that the isc_buffer_* functions (macros) that return
782 * pointers would still need to return non-const pointers to avoid compiler
783 * warnings, so it would be up to code that uses them to have to deal
784 * with the possibility that the buffer was initialized as const --
785 * a problem that they *already* have to deal with but have absolutely
786 * no ability to. With a new isc_buffer_isconst() function returning
787 * true/false, they could at least assert a contractual requirement for
788 * non-const buffers when needed.
789 */
790#define ISC__BUFFER_INIT(_b, _base, _length) \
791 do { \
792 (_b)->base = _base; \
793 (_b)->length = (_length); \
794 (_b)->used = 0; \
795 (_b)->current = 0; \
796 (_b)->active = 0; \
797 (_b)->mctx = NULL; \
798 ISC_LINK_INIT(_b, link); \
799 (_b)->magic = ISC_BUFFER_MAGIC; \
800 (_b)->autore = false; \
801 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
802
803#define ISC__BUFFER_INITNULL(_b) ISC__BUFFER_INIT(_b, NULL, 0)
804
805#define ISC__BUFFER_INVALIDATE(_b) \
806 do { \
807 (_b)->magic = 0; \
808 (_b)->base = NULL; \
809 (_b)->length = 0; \
810 (_b)->used = 0; \
811 (_b)->current = 0; \
812 (_b)->active = 0; \
813 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
814
815#define ISC__BUFFER_REGION(_b, _r) \
816 do { \
817 (_r)->base = (_b)->base; \
818 (_r)->length = (_b)->length; \
819 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
820
821#define ISC__BUFFER_USEDREGION(_b, _r) \
822 do { \
823 (_r)->base = (_b)->base; \
824 (_r)->length = (_b)->used; \
825 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
826
827#define ISC__BUFFER_AVAILABLEREGION(_b, _r) \
828 do { \
829 (_r)->base = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
830 (_r)->length = isc_buffer_availablelength(_b); \
831 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
832
833#define ISC__BUFFER_ADD(_b, _n) \
834 do { \
835 (_b)->used += (_n); \
836 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
837
838#define ISC__BUFFER_SUBTRACT(_b, _n) \
839 do { \
840 (_b)->used -= (_n); \
841 if ((_b)->current > (_b)->used) \
842 (_b)->current = (_b)->used; \
843 if ((_b)->active > (_b)->used) \
844 (_b)->active = (_b)->used; \
845 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
846
847#define ISC__BUFFER_CLEAR(_b) \
848 do { \
849 (_b)->used = 0; \
850 (_b)->current = 0; \
851 (_b)->active = 0; \
852 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
853
854#define ISC__BUFFER_CONSUMEDREGION(_b, _r) \
855 do { \
856 (_r)->base = (_b)->base; \
857 (_r)->length = (_b)->current; \
858 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
859
860#define ISC__BUFFER_REMAININGREGION(_b, _r) \
861 do { \
862 (_r)->base = isc_buffer_current(_b); \
863 (_r)->length = isc_buffer_remaininglength(_b); \
864 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
865
866#define ISC__BUFFER_ACTIVEREGION(_b, _r) \
867 do { \
868 if ((_b)->current < (_b)->active) { \
869 (_r)->base = isc_buffer_current(_b); \
870 (_r)->length = isc_buffer_activelength(_b); \
871 } else { \
872 (_r)->base = NULL; \
873 (_r)->length = 0; \
874 } \
875 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
876
877#define ISC__BUFFER_SETACTIVE(_b, _n) \
878 do { \
879 (_b)->active = (_b)->current + (_n); \
880 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
881
882#define ISC__BUFFER_FIRST(_b) \
883 do { \
884 (_b)->current = 0; \
885 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
886
887#define ISC__BUFFER_FORWARD(_b, _n) \
888 do { \
889 (_b)->current += (_n); \
890 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
891
892#define ISC__BUFFER_BACK(_b, _n) \
893 do { \
894 (_b)->current -= (_n); \
895 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
896
897#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTMEM(_b, _base, _length) \
898 do { \
899 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
900 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
901 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, _length) \
902 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
903 } \
904 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= (unsigned int) _length); \
905 if (_length > 0U) { \
906 memmove(isc_buffer_used(_b), (_base), (_length)); \
907 (_b)->used += (_length); \
908 } \
909 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
910
911#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTSTR(_b, _source) \
912 do { \
913 unsigned int _length; \
914 unsigned char *_cp; \
915 _length = (unsigned int)strlen(_source); \
916 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
917 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
918 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, _length) \
919 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
920 } \
921 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= _length); \
922 _cp = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
923 memmove(_cp, (_source), _length); \
924 (_b)->used += (_length); \
925 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
926
927#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT8(_b, _val) \
928 do { \
929 unsigned char *_cp; \
930 /* evaluate (_val) only once */ \
931 uint8_t _val2 = (_val); \
932 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
933 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
934 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, 1) \
935 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
936 } \
937 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= 1U); \
938 _cp = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
939 (_b)->used++; \
940 _cp[0] = _val2; \
941 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
942
943#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT16(_b, _val) \
944 do { \
945 unsigned char *_cp; \
946 /* evaluate (_val) only once */ \
947 uint16_t _val2 = (_val); \
948 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
949 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
950 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, 2) \
951 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
952 } \
953 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= 2U); \
954 _cp = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
955 (_b)->used += 2; \
956 _cp[0] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 8); \
957 _cp[1] = (unsigned char)_val2; \
958 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
959
960#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT24(_b, _val) \
961 do { \
962 unsigned char *_cp; \
963 /* evaluate (_val) only once */ \
964 uint32_t _val2 = (_val); \
965 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
966 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
967 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, 3) \
968 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
969 } \
970 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= 3U); \
971 _cp = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
972 (_b)->used += 3; \
973 _cp[0] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 16); \
974 _cp[1] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 8); \
975 _cp[2] = (unsigned char)_val2; \
976 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
977
978#define ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT32(_b, _val) \
979 do { \
980 unsigned char *_cp; \
981 /* evaluate (_val) only once */ \
982 uint32_t _val2 = (_val); \
983 if (ISC_UNLIKELY((_b)->autore)) { \
984 isc_buffer_t *_tmp = _b; \
985 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_reserve(&_tmp, 4) \
986 == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
987 } \
988 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_buffer_availablelength(_b) >= 4U); \
989 _cp = isc_buffer_used(_b); \
990 (_b)->used += 4; \
991 _cp[0] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 24); \
992 _cp[1] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 16); \
993 _cp[2] = (unsigned char)(_val2 >> 8); \
994 _cp[3] = (unsigned char)_val2; \
995 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
996
997#if defined(ISC_BUFFER_USEINLINE)
998#define isc_buffer_init ISC__BUFFER_INIT
999#define isc_buffer_initnull ISC__BUFFER_INITNULL
1000#define isc_buffer_invalidate ISC__BUFFER_INVALIDATE
1001#define isc_buffer_region ISC__BUFFER_REGION
1002#define isc_buffer_usedregion ISC__BUFFER_USEDREGION
1003#define isc_buffer_availableregion ISC__BUFFER_AVAILABLEREGION
1004#define isc_buffer_add ISC__BUFFER_ADD
1005#define isc_buffer_subtract ISC__BUFFER_SUBTRACT
1006#define isc_buffer_clear ISC__BUFFER_CLEAR
1007#define isc_buffer_consumedregion ISC__BUFFER_CONSUMEDREGION
1008#define isc_buffer_remainingregion ISC__BUFFER_REMAININGREGION
1009#define isc_buffer_activeregion ISC__BUFFER_ACTIVEREGION
1010#define isc_buffer_setactive ISC__BUFFER_SETACTIVE
1011#define isc_buffer_first ISC__BUFFER_FIRST
1012#define isc_buffer_forward ISC__BUFFER_FORWARD
1013#define isc_buffer_back ISC__BUFFER_BACK
1014#define isc_buffer_putmem ISC__BUFFER_PUTMEM
1015#define isc_buffer_putstr ISC__BUFFER_PUTSTR
1016#define isc_buffer_putuint8 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT8
1017#define isc_buffer_putuint16 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT16
1018#define isc_buffer_putuint24 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT24
1019#define isc_buffer_putuint32 ISC__BUFFER_PUTUINT32
1020#else
1021#define isc_buffer_init isc__buffer_init
1022#define isc_buffer_initnull isc__buffer_initnull
1023#define isc_buffer_invalidate isc__buffer_invalidate
1024#define isc_buffer_region isc__buffer_region
1025#define isc_buffer_usedregion isc__buffer_usedregion
1026#define isc_buffer_availableregion isc__buffer_availableregion
1027#define isc_buffer_add isc__buffer_add
1028#define isc_buffer_subtract isc__buffer_subtract
1029#define isc_buffer_clear isc__buffer_clear
1030#define isc_buffer_consumedregion isc__buffer_consumedregion
1031#define isc_buffer_remainingregion isc__buffer_remainingregion
1032#define isc_buffer_activeregion isc__buffer_activeregion
1033#define isc_buffer_setactive isc__buffer_setactive
1034#define isc_buffer_first isc__buffer_first
1035#define isc_buffer_forward isc__buffer_forward
1036#define isc_buffer_back isc__buffer_back
1037#define isc_buffer_putmem isc__buffer_putmem
1038#define isc_buffer_putstr isc__buffer_putstr
1039#define isc_buffer_putuint8 isc__buffer_putuint8
1040#define isc_buffer_putuint16 isc__buffer_putuint16
1041#define isc_buffer_putuint24 isc__buffer_putuint24
1042#define isc_buffer_putuint32 isc__buffer_putuint32
1043#endif
1044
1045#define isc_buffer_constinit(_b, _d, _l) \
1046 do { \
1047 union { void *_var; const void *_const; } _deconst; \
1048 _deconst._const = (_d); \
1049 isc_buffer_init((_b), _deconst._var, (_l)); \
1050 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)

1052/*
1053 * No inline method for this one (yet).
1054 */
1055#define isc_buffer_putuint48 isc__buffer_putuint48

1057#endif /* ISC_BUFFER_H */
